intro: Johreniopsis seseloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sesel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers clustered in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. Johreniopsis seseloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
